hanzi-su-wiki:
傘

Значения

Зонтик

Мнемоника

Китайский зонт. Внизу — ручка, выше — спицы, вверху — ткань.

Варианты

伞, 仐

heisig_chinese_memo: There are two assembly lines for putting together parts at the umbrella factory. One is responsible for making the top of the umbrella, and the other for making the handle. The two lines cross at the end, where one man tries frantically to jam the sets of parts together.
heisig_constituent: umbrella, umbrella, assembly line, person, ten, needle, person4, assembly line2
koohiiStory1: FOUR PERSONS can fit under this UMBRELLA if they are thin as a NEEDLE.
koohiiStory2: There are two assembly lines at the umbrella factory. One is responsible for making the top of the umbrella, and the other for making the handle. The two lines cross at the end, where one man tries frantically to jam the sets of parts together.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: As a hat, four people holding a cross use an umbrella. The umbrella is big enough to be a hat for all four people, so it makes sense. All four of them are religious missionaries, so that’s why they’re holding the cross.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: See these four people all under one umbrella. No one is carrying the umbrella, it’s just resting on all of their heads like a hat. Their hands are busy holding that cross, anyway.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You know the Spanish phrase “Mi casa (かさ) es su casa”? Well this is kind of like that, but only with a hat. And that hat is an umbrella. Mi casa es yours too, because it’s an umbrella and also a hat. This makes sense, trust me.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine the four people in the umbrella hat again, only this time imagine them skipping along singing “Mi casa es su casa”. It’ll help you remember.
Ru_Radicals: 人 (человек), 个 (китайский счётный суффикс), 十 (десять)
Ru_trainchinese: sǎn: (сущ) зонт, зонтик; предмет в форме зонтика
Kanshudo_mnemonic: one man (𠆢) and ten (十) times four men (人) are under an umbrella
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Pictograph of an umbrella.  This umbrella uses animal horns as the spokes and a big needle as the main pole/handle thing.
humanum_full_description_en:
The shape of the curtain cover, the original meaning is the umbrella cover, a kind of ancient ceremonial equipment. "Ji Yun": "Umbrella, cover too. Or from the scarf, also used as an umbrella." "Wei Shu‧ Pei Liang Biography": "From time to time there were Wucheng County Shanhu Feng Yidu, He Yue Huicheng, etc. deceiving people, falsely titled emperor. , Dress in plain clothes, hold white umbrellas and white banners, and lead all the rebellious people to resist the king in the suburbs of Yuntai."

" Umbrellas " are often used as rain and shade equipment. Song Yang Wanli "Leaving Gui Yuyu": "Small traces of smoke and grass are low, the early rain shadow umbrella prophet."
148 Characters
humanum_short_description_en: The shape of a screen cover, the original meaning is an umbrella cover, a kind of ancient ceremonial guard.
humanum_full_description:
象幕蓋之形，本義為傘蓋，古代儀仗用具的一種。《集韻》：「繖，蓋也。或從巾，亦作傘。」《魏書‧裴良傳》：「時有五城郡山胡馮宜都、賀悅回城等以妖妄惑眾，假稱帝號，服素衣，持白傘白幡，率諸逆眾，於雲臺郊抗拒王師。」

　　「傘」常用作擋雨、遮陽用具。宋楊萬里〈脫歸遇雨〉：「略略煙痕草許低，初初雨影傘先知。」
148 Characters
humanum_short_description: 象幕蓋之形，本義為傘蓋，古代儀仗用具的一種。

傘字的基本解释

傘
sǎn
见“伞”。

傘字的汉语字典释义

[①]［sǎn］
［《廣韻》蘇旱切，上旱，心。］
“繖1”的今字。“伞1”的繁体字。
(1)特指伞盖。古代一种仪仗物。长柄，圆顶，伞面边缘有流苏下垂。每以不同颜色标识官品高下。
(2)由柄、骨、盖三部分组成，可以张合的挡雨或遮阳的用具。

傘字的康熙字典解释

【子集中】【人字部】　傘； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页113第20
【廣韻】蘇旱切【集韻】顙旱切，?音散。禦雨蔽日，可以卷舒者。通作繖。亦作?。【說文】蓋也。【通雅】繖本因古之縿，升庵謂傘亦古文，晉輿服志，功曹吏繖扇騎從傘。始見於南史，王縉以笠傘覆面。魏書裴延儁傳，山胡持白傘白旛。○按《說文》幓，旌旗之斿。《爾雅》纁帛縿。註：衆旒所著正幅爲縿。此卽繖之原也。　又地名。【遼史·太宗紀】駐蹕於傘淀。

傘字的源字形

Basic explanation of words
umbrella
sǎn
See "Umbrella".
umbrella
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［sǎn］
["Guangyun" Su drought cuts, drought, heart. ]
The present character for "umbrella 1". Traditional characters for "伞1".
(1) Especially the umbrella cover. A kind of guard of honor in ancient times. Long handle, dome, and tassels drooping on the edge of the umbrella surface. Each uses a different color to identify the superiority of the official product.
(2) It consists of a handle, a bone, and a cover, which can be opened and closed to block rain or shade.
umbrella
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Subset] [Human Character Department] 　umbrella; Kangxi strokes: 12; Page number: page 113 to 20
[Guang Yun] Su Han cut [Ji Yun] Dry cut in Qi, with loose sound. The rain can cover the sun, and the person who can roll and relax. Pass as an umbrella. Also for?. [Said the text] Gai Ye. [Tongya] The umbrella is based on the ancient 縿, and Shengan said that the umbrella is also ancient. Jin Yufuzhi, and the Umbrella fan rides from the umbrella. First seen in Southern History, Wang Jin covered his face with an umbrella. Wei Shu Pei Yanjun Biography, Shan Hu holding a white umbrella and white banner. ○Press "Shuowen", the banner of the flag. "ELEGANCE" 纁帛縿. Note: The main frame of the work by Zhongqi is 縿. This is also the origin of the umbrella.　Also place name. 【Liao History·Tai Zong Ji】stayed in Sandian.

sǎn
вм. 伞
Radicals: 人, 十  (person, cross, hat)
Meaning Mnemonic
As a hat, four people holding a cross use an umbrella. The umbrella is big enough to be a hat for all four people, so it makes sense. All four of them are religious missionaries, so that’s why they’re holding the cross.
See these four people all under one umbrella. No one is carrying the umbrella, it’s just resting on all of their heads like a hat. Their hands are busy holding that cross, anyway.
Reading Mnemonic
You know the Spanish phrase “Mi casa (かさ) es su casa”? Well this is kind of like that, but only with a hat. And that hat is an umbrella. Mi casa es yours too, because it’s an umbrella and also a hat. This makes sense, trust me.
Imagine the four people in the umbrella hat again, only this time imagine them skipping along singing “Mi casa es su casa”. It’ll help you remember.
